resources.string: Search by case name or modules
Case 1. When you open this screen, the keyboard are immediately shown and EditText view below has focus. Use button on the right side to defocus view and hide keyboard

Case 2. Use Show button to show keybord, but EditText view on the center will not have focus. Use Hide button to hide keyboard. If EditText view will have focus and you will use Hide button, keyboard will be hidden, but EditText will have focus
Case 1: Add number in EditText view below, and format number to formated input using Format button
Case 2: Add number in EditText view below, and format it to formated string using Format button
Case 3: Add something in EditText view below, and get only numbers from string you added using Get numbers button
Case 4: Luhn algorithm check. This only works if you are certain all input will be at least 10 characters
Case 5: Add card number and get card type using Card type button

Switch manager from the Util module is created for handling enabling and disabling views. With the first custom switcher you can enable/disable views using the basic SwitchManager from the module, with the second one you can do the same but with the overridden SwitchManager.
Base SwitchManager can enable/disable view if it implements ISwitchView interface or if it is an EditText
Custom SwitchManager overriding base SwitchManager and also can enable/disable view if it is a Button ot SwitchMaterial
Before become isChecked switcher checks for a non-empty field below. Enter something in the input field and turn on the switcher
Use this switcher for enabling and disabling views on the screen. Switcher is on - enable views, off - disable
Create your own CustomSwitcher. Use functional below to add characteristics and style to your view.
Add padding to switcher and information text
Use this switcher to enable/disable views on the screen
Case 1: Listheader view with title, icon on the right. Click on container to open/close list below. Use Add button below to add more text view to Listheader
Case 2: Listheader view without title, icon on the right is clickable
Case 3: Listheader view with title, clickable action text on the right and clickable container

Create ListHeader with functional below. Created Listheader is clickable and in its container will have TextViews which will be shown or hidden. Remember: when you add action text action icon becomes invisible
Case 1. Topbar without any icons, but with divider
Case 3. Topbar with navigation icon and actionView on the right, with handler for handling clicks
Case 4. Topbar with action icon on the right
Case 5. Topbar with actionView on the left
Case 6. Topbar with actionView on the left and actionIcon on the right. Use button below to change title, actionView and action icon, with handler for handling clicks
Case 7. Topbar with actionViews. Use button below to change style of topbar
Case 8. Topbar with actionView on the right
Case 9. Topbar with two icons and two actionViews, but icons are not visible cause actionViews are in priority, with handler for handling clicks
Case 10. Topbar with two icons, with handler for handling clicks
Case 1. Card with icons, cardValueAlignment inherit, two dividers, all paddings and default title width percent
Case 2. Card with end icon, cardValueAlignment center, two dividers, text style and title width percent 0.1
Case 3. Card value without title, icons, top divider and with long text, cardValueAlignment textEnd
Case 4. Just title with long text, no dividers
Case 5. Card value with fixed height, dividers and all parts have different vertical bias. You can use button below to change cardline style
Create your own Cardline. Use functional below to add characteristics and style to your view.
Add vertical bias for title and value text:
Case 1: Pin view with a base style. Use button below to add/restore pin items or clear all added pins.
Case 2: Pin view with a custom style. Animation time to fill pin is 1 second, to unfilled pin is 0.5 second. Use button below to add/restore pin items or clear all added pins.
Here will be your Pin view
Add amount of cells and cells size
Add time in mls for cells animation in/out
Create your own Pin view using functional below
Create your own Message Dialog. Use functional below to add characteristics and style to your dialog.
Add something with the length from 1 to 20
Use this bottom dialog to send entered data to Fragment. If you click on Send button and entered data is correct the dialog will be closed and you will see Toast message with entered data.
Re-open this case to see Bottom Dialog again
On this screen you can check functional of InputfieldView and see different styles of views.
Case 2: Custom InputFieldView with two icons, label, help text. When you set error box stroke, label and start icon will have error color
Case 3: Custom InputFieldView with styled box, start icon mode checkable and end icon mode custom. When you set error only box stroke will have error color
Case 4: InputFieldView with start icon mode progress and end icon mode text. When you set error box stroke and end text will have error color
Case 5: InputFieldView with icons. Error color will be the same for each parts of view
Case 6: InputFieldView without icons. When you set error only box stroke will have own error color
Click this buttons to set/reset errors to all inputField views
On this screen you can check functional of InputfieldView end icon.
Case 2. InputfieldView with end icon in Clear text mode
Case 3. InputfieldView with end icon in Password toggle mode
Case 4. InputfieldView with end icon in Custom mode
Case 5. InputfieldView with end icon in Text mode
Case 6. InputfieldView with end icon in Checkable mode
Case 7. InputfieldView with end icon in Error mode
Use buttons to set and reset errors for all Inputfield views
Use this button to change end icons styles for all Inputfield views
On this screen you can check functional of InputfieldView start icon.
Case 2. InputfieldView with start icon in Checkable mode
Case 3. InputfieldView with start icon in Custom mode
Case 4. InputfieldView with start icon in Default mode
Case 5. InputfieldView with start icon in Progress mode
Use buttons to set and reset errors for all Inputfield views
Use this button to change start icons styles for all Inputfield views

Go to another fragment using two buttons. With first button you can navigate without args, with second button navigate and pass entered in field date. \nTo go back to menu use system back button or button on app top bar.
Go to second fragment without args
Go to second fragment with args
Received data, if data was sent here:
Use field below to pass data with pop back
To go back to previous screen without args use button below, navigation icon on app top bar or system back button.
To go back to previous screen with args use button below and add data to input field above. Then you will see entered data on previous screen on Toast.
To back to the previous screen and pop back from it too use button below(in this case you will go to Menu).
On this screen you can different functional of BaseUI module.
Use this button to open message dialog
Start adding data in input field to make field focusable, than tap somewhere outside the field. Field becomes unfocusable and keyboard will be hidden
Use buttons below to check and request permissions to read/write external storage.
Use this button to request a group of permissions.
*After confirming permissions, you can remove them in the application settings.
Use buttons below to check how viewModel handle error with different types of showing errors.
Use buttons below to check how fragment handle error with different types of showing errors.
Use this case to change app language and theme. Other screen will have English translations. New settings won\'t be saved after app closing. Language by default is English and theme is system.

Use this case to check domain use case functionality and play with random numbers. The game is to match the number you guessed with the random number from 0 to range number. \nIf you guess the number you will see congratulations message, otherwise you will see error dialog.
